ygData.subject: RE: How to develop skill at high levels?
ygData.msgSnippet: Hey there, Sorry I can t answer any of your questions, but your questions have been rolling around in my head for some time.  Specifically, when should you
ygData.messageBody:
Hey there,

Sorry I can't answer any of your questions, but your questions have been
rolling around in my head for some time. Specifically, when should you move
to higher components and when is it OK to move to bows?

I have a fletching skill of 50 currently. I am now using wood shafts,
medium nocks, parablolic flights and field points I believe. When this
becomes trivial, which item should I increase? When should I start making
bows and when should I advance the wood?

Thanks for any help.

Lidin - Level 12 Ranger and Apprentice Fletcher


-----Original Message-----
From: bonecrkr@... [mailto:bonecrkr@...]
Sent: Thursday, September 30, 1999 1:44 PM
To: EQ_Fletchers@onelist.com
Subject: [EQ_Fletchers] How to develop skill at high levels?


From: bonecrkr@...

I could use a little advice from any of the GrandMaster Fletchers out there.
I've been working the Fletching skill pretty hard (to quote one of the
guides on fletchin, making arrows until my eyes bleed) and my skill is now
170. I'm currently making arrows with Large Nocks, Wood Shafts, Field
Points and ceramic vanes. Unfortunately, it is now becoming teminally
expensive to level the skill up (at least with the ceramic vanes). They are
not trivial but are no longer driving my skill up at an acceptable rate.
Before I flush more pp away, could someone with level 200 skill tell me if I
should stick with ceramic vanes (if so, until when) or move on to cheap
components with steel shafts (until when) and then cheap components with
blade points. Also, I'd like some info on making the high end bows. For
example, is it safe to start working with Oak yet and at what point am I
likely not to cry from a failure with Darkwood? I read somewhere that
planing tools and knives add 20 to t!
!
!
he skill needed to make a bow and that cams are for Oak and Darkwood only.
Do they add to the difficulty of making a bow? I notice that, since the
patch our fletching kit has more spots. I take it that we can now make 2
cam bows and plane them etc. Does this actually work (rather not discover a
bug by investing good pp, hehe) What is a good price to charge for the Oak
and Ashwood bows or even the trueshot if I get my lazy butt up to do the
quest.
